item.title: Tarique Rahman seeks ‘doa’ for his mother as millions join funeral
item.description: BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman sought doa (supplication) for eternal peace of the departed soul of his mother Begum Khaleda Zia, three-time former Prime Minister and the party’s chairperson, prior to her Namaz-e-Janaza at Manik Mia Avenue this afternoon. “I am Tarique Rahman,

item.title: Jatiya Party postpones 40th founding anniversary programmes
item.description: All programmes marking the 40th founding anniversary of the Jatiya Party have been postponed following the declaration of state mourning over the death of BNP Chairperson and former prime minister Khaleda Zia. The decision was announced in a statement issued on Wednesday. The party’s foundi

item.title: 11 lakh voters register to vote by post
item.description: A total of 1,125,263 voters have registered so far to cast postal votes in the 13th National Parliament Election and Referendum. In addition to expatriate Bangladeshis, officials and employees assigned to election duties and government employees stationed outside their localities are registering t

item.title: DITF plays vital role to promote domestic products, expand exports: CA
item.description: Chief Adviser Professor Muhammad Yunus on Wednesday called upon all participating countries and institutions at the Dhaka International Trade Fair (DITF) to work together in a spirit of mutual cooperation and partnership. “The interim government has remained firmly committed to safeguarding

item.title: Interim govt advisers meet foreign dignitaries, express gratitude
item.description: Law Adviser Dr Asif Nazrul and National Security Adviser Dr Khalilur Rahman on Wednesday met visiting Indian External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, Speaker of the Pakistan National Assembly Sardar Ayaz Sadiq, Nepal’s Foreign Minister Bala Nanda Sharma and Bhutan’s Foreign Minister DN D

item.title: Thieves drill into German bank vault and make off with millions
item.description: Thieves used the quiet Christmas period to drill their way into the vault of a German retail bank and make off with at least 10 million euros' worth of money and valuables from customers' deposit boxes, police said on Tuesday. The perpetrators drilled through a thick concrete wall at a branch of S

item.title: Finland suspects ship of causing undersea cable damage, president says
item.description: Finnish authorities have inspected a vessel suspected of causing undersea cable damage in the Gulf of Finland, President Alexander Stubb said on Wednesday. Baltic Sea nations have been on high alert after a string of outages of power cables, telecom links and gas pipelines since Russia invaded Ukr

item.title: From battleships to buildings: Trump's name is everywhere
item.description: As a New York businessman, President Donald Trump put his name on real estate, golf courses, vodka, steaks, bottled water and his own university. As president in his second term, he is merging his personal brand with national institutions and government programs, an unusual assertion of power by a

item.title: Rooted in Feni: The neem tree that bears Khaleda’s memory
item.description: At the gate of Majumdar Bari in Fulgazi, Feni, a neem tree planted decades ago by BNP Chairperson Khaleda Zia still stands, quietly preserving a living memory of her ties to the ancestral home. Back in 2008, during a visit to her ancestral house, Majumdar Bari at Shreepur village of Fulgazi Upazil

item.title: Myanmar junta says voter turnout at 52pc in first phase of election
item.description: Myanmar's junta said slightly more than half of eligible voters cast their ballot in the first phase of a three-stage national election at the weekend, a figure that was markedly lower than the previous two elections. The election is the first since a 2021 coup and is taking place during a civil w

item.title: Drugmakers raise US prices on 350 medicines despite pressure from Trump
item.description: Drugmakers plan to raise US prices on at least 350 branded medications including vaccines against COVID, RSV and shingles and blockbuster cancer treatment Ibrance, even as the Trump administration pressures them for cuts, according to data provided exclusively by healthcare research firm 3 Axis Adv

item.title: BNP vows to walk Khaleda’s path
item.description: Millions stood shoulder to shoulder beneath an open winter sky as Bangladesh bid farewell to Khaleda Zia—a leader whose political life was defined by defiance, endurance and unyielding belief in democracy. Moments before her funeral prayers, the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) pledged to
